metadata.description:
This dataset includes five scenes, covering the artificial oasis eco-hydrology experimental area of the Heihe River Basin, which were acquired on (yy-mm-dd) 2012-04-05, 2012-04-21, 2012-05-07, 2012-06-24, 2012-07-10.
The data were all acquired around 11:50 (BJT) with data product of Level 2.  
Landsat ETM+ dataset was downloaded from http://glovis.usgs.gov/.

literatureList.titleEn: Comprehensive Remote Sensing Observation Joint Experiment Overall Design for Ecological-Hydrological Processes in the Heilong River Basin
Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER): Scientific objectives and experimental design
literatureList.referenceEn: Li X, Cheng GD, Liu SM, Xiao Q, Ma MG, Jin R, Che T, Liu QH, Wang WZ, Qi Y, Wen JG, Li HY, Zhu GF, Guo JW, Ran YH, Wang SG, Zhu ZL, Zhou J, Hu XL, Xu ZW. Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER): Scientific objectives and experimental design. Bulletin of the American Meteorological Society, 2013, 94(8): 1145-1160, 10.1175/BAMS-D-12-00154.1.

placeKeywordList.keywordEn: the artificial oasis experimental area in the middle reaches

fundVOList.titleEn: Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER)

Disjunctive.Question: Is the primary challenge in using Landsat 7 ETM+ data related to data overlap, data loss, or geometric correction?

Quantification.Question: How many Landsat ETM+ images were collected in the midstream artificial oasis eco-hydrological experimental area in 2012?

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors contributed to the need for SLC-off model correction in Landsat 7 ETM+ data collection after May 31, 2003?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The need for SLC-off model correction arose due to a malfunction in the Landsat-7 ETM+ Scan Line Corrector (SLC) on May 31, 2003, which resulted in data overlap and approximately 25% data loss. This malfunction made all subsequent data acquired by Landsat 7 abnormal, necessitating correction models to ensure data usability.

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the potential consequences of using SLC-off data without proper correction methods in ecological and hydrological remote sensing studies?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Using SLC-off data without proper correction methods can result in incomplete or inaccurate datasets due to data overlap and approximately 25% data loss, which may lead to incorrect interpretations or conclusions in ecological and hydrological remote sensing studies.

Goal Orientation.Question: What are the objectives of utilizing Landsat ETM+ remote sensing data for monitoring ecological and hydrological processes in artificial oasis regions?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The objective of utilizing Landsat ETM+ remote sensing data is to monitor ecological and hydrological processes in the middle reaches of artificial oasis regions. This involves capturing high-quality imagery to observe changes over time, despite challenges such as the Scan Line Corrector failure, which requires specific corrections for data post-2003. The data is intended to support comprehensive remote sensing observations as part of the Heihe River Basin's ecological-hydrological process studies.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures are involved in correcting the anomalies in Landsat 7 ETM+ imagery data collected after the SLC failure?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: After the SLC failure on May 31, 2003, all Landsat 7 ETM+ data are considered anomalous and require correction using the SLC-off model to address issues of data overlap and approximately 25% data loss.
